page.title: 10ARABLE FARM, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: One {arable}farm fell completely within this block, but it is worked as part of a unit consisting of several farms, scattered over a wide area. Crops are rotated on a four-year cycle, to prevent disease. This farm covers 162 acres, of which half was under {wheat} in 1985. A quarter was under {oil-seed rape}and the remainder carried{barley, beans and potatoes.} The yard occupied one and a half acres, and contained sheds with a corn-drier and shelter for the tractors, combine-harvesters and rape swathers. The farmer also runs a land-drainage firm, which employs up to ten men when they are busy. Some of his yard is occupied by rolls of plastic drainage piping of different diameters and colours, waiting to be installed. His only livestock is one dog.
